a.xlink:title: Slicer class hierarchy
class Slicer

__init__(self, *items_to_instrument, dependency_tracker=None, globals=None, log=False): Create a slicer. `items_to_instrument` are Python functions or modules with source code. `dependency_tracker` is the tracker to be used (default: DependencyTracker). `globals` is the namespace to be used (default: caller's `globals()`) `log`=True or `log` > 0 turns on logging
code(self, *args, **kwargs): Show code of instrumented items, annotated with dependencies.
dependencies(self): Return collected dependencies.
execute(self, tree, item): Compile and execute `tree`. May be extended in subclasses.
graph(self, *args, **kwargs): Show dependency graph.
instrument(self, item): Instrument `item`, transforming its source code, and re-defining it.
parse(self, item): Parse `item`, returning its AST
restore(self): Restore original code.
transform(self, tree): Apply transformers on `tree`. May be extended in subclasses.
transformers(self): List of transformers to apply. To be extended in subclasses.
class Instrumenter
__enter__(self): Instrument sources
__exit__(self, exc_type, exc_value, traceback): Restore sources

__init__(self, *items_to_instrument, globals=None, log=False): Create an instrumenter. `items_to_instrument` is a list of items to instrument. `globals` is a namespace to use (default: caller's globals())
instrument(self, item): Instrument `item`. To be overloaded in subclasses.
class StackInspector
caller_frame(self): Return the frame of the caller.
caller_function(self): Return the calling function
caller_globals(self): Return the globals() environment of the caller.
caller_locals(self): Return the locals() environment of the caller.
caller_location(self): Return the location (func, lineno) of the caller.
search_frame(self, name): Return a pair (`frame`, `item`) in which the function `name` is defined as `item`.
search_func(self, name): Search in callers for a definition of the function `name`
class DependencyTracker
__enter__(self): Track entering an if/while/for block
__exit__(self, exc_type, exc_value, traceback): Track exiting an if/while/for block
arg(self, value, pos=None, kw=None): Track passing an argument `value` (with given position `pos` 1..n or keyword `kw`)
call(self, func): Track a call of function `func`
call_generator(self, func): Track a call of a generator function
check_location(self): If we are in a new location, clear set of read variables
clear_read(self): Clear set of read variables
dependencies(self): Return dependencies
get(self, name, value): Track a read access for variable `name` with value `value`
in_generator(self): True if we are calling a generator function

param(self, name, value, pos=None, vararg='', last=False): Track getting a parameter `name` with value `value` (with given position `pos`). vararg parameters are indicated by setting `varargs` to '*' (*args) or '**' (**kwargs)
ret(self, value): Track a function return
ret_generator(self, generator): Track the return of a generator function
set(self, name, value, loads=None): Add a dependency for `name` = `value`
test(self, value): Track a test for condition `value`
__init__(self, *args, **kwargs)
class DataTracker
__init__(self, log=False): Initialize. If `log` is set, turn on logging.
augment(self, name, value): Track augmenting `name` with `value`.
get(self, name, value): Track getting `value` from `name`.
set(self, name, value, loads=None): Track setting `name` to `value`.
__exit__(self, exc_type, exc_value, traceback)
arg(self, value, pos=None, kw=None)
call(self, func)
param(self, name, value, pos=None, vararg='', last=False)
ret(self, value)
test(self, cond)
class Dependencies

__init__(self, data=None, control=None):
Create a dependency graph from `data` and `control`. Both `data` and `control` are dictionaries holding _nodes_ as keys and sets of nodes as values. Each node comes as a tuple (variable_name, location) where `variable_name` is a string and `location` is a pair (function, lineno) where `function` is a callable and `lineno` is a line number denoting a unique location in the code.
__str__(self): Return string representation of dependencies
add_hierarchy(self, g): Add invisible edges for a proper hierarchy.

backward_slice(self, *criteria, mode='cd', depth=-1): Create a backward slice from nodes `criteria`. `mode` can contain 'c' (draw control dependencies) and 'd' (draw data dependencies) (default: 'cd')

code(self, *items, mode='cd'): List `items` on standard output, including dependencies as comments. If `items` is empty, all included functions are listed. `mode` can contain 'c' (draw control dependencies) and 'd' (draw data dependencies) (default: 'cd').
expand_criteria(self, criteria): Return list of vars matched by `criteria`.
format_var(self, var, current_func=None): Return string for `var` in `current_func`.
graph(self): Draw dependencies.
id(self, var): Return a unique ID for `var`.
label(self, var): Render node `var` using HTML style.
source(self, node): Return the source code for a given node.
tooltip(self, var): Return a tooltip for node `var`.
validate(self): Perform a simple syntactic validation of dependencies
_code(self, item, mode)
_source(self, node)
draw_dependencies(self, g)
make_graph(self, name='dependencies', comment='Dependencies')
repr_dependencies(self, vars)
repr_deps(self, var_set)
repr_var(self, var)
